attributes.additional_details: Cyclists purchase a licence and get issued a licence ID number this ID allowes you to purchase a road tax disc from DVLA the tax disc has your licence ID and should be displayed under the seat so can be viewed clearly from behind allowing you to cycle on UK roads, and be identified like a number plate,and forced to have minimum insurance like every other road user .why should vehicle road tax payers share roads with cyclists who do not pay their share?or have any insurance?or accountability?
